sentences: Chaya Czernowin (Hebrew: חיה צ'רנובין, Hebrew pronunciation: [ˌχaja t͡ʃɛʁˈnobin]; born December 7, 1957) is an Israeli American composer, and Walter Bigelow Rosen Professor of Music at Harvard University.
She is a 2011 Guggenheim Fellow.
Czernowin studied at the Rubin Academy of music at Tel-Aviv University, Bard College, and received her PhD from the University of California, San Diego in 1993.
Czernowin spent several years after her formal studies on residencies and fellowships in Japan, Europe, and the United States.
She was awarded the Ernst von Siemens Music Composers' Prize in 2003.
From 1997–2006, she was professor of composition at UCSD, and between 2006–2009 she was professor of composition at the University of Music and Performing Arts, Vienna.
